definition: to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)

sentences.english: Please think of five words about the color.
sentences.chinese: 请说出五个有关颜色的词。

sentences.english: Silent dissenters may not have yet dared voice their doubts.
sentences.chinese: 沉默的反对者可能不敢说出他们的疑问。

sentences.english: Can you identify the part of speech of this word?
sentences.chinese: 能说出这个单词的词类吗？

sentences.english: In these words, a correct expression is given to the finitude of Will.
sentences.chinese: 这样便已经正确说出意志的有限性了。

sentences.english: And the roses and the hymn-book told the real truth.
sentences.chinese: 玫瑰花与圣歌都说出了真正的事实。

sentences.english: The girl frightened trembles , said that got rid the serial number.
sentences.chinese: 女孩吓得哆哆嗦嗦，说出了手机号。

sentences.english: You didn't say the magic word. It's "please, " remember?
sentences.chinese: 你没说出最关键的字。就是‘请’，记得吗？

sentences.english: And experts think he is close to his first two-syllable word.
sentences.chinese: 专家认为，这名男孩很快就能够说出双音节字。

sentences.english: Underline the infinitives in the following sentences and tell their functions.
sentences.chinese: 用横线划出下列句子中的不定式，并说出它们的作用。

sentences.english: The words will never show. the you I've come to know.
sentences.chinese: 千言万语无法说出我所认识的你。

sentences.english: A word once spoken cannot be taken back, even with a team of four horses.
sentences.chinese: 一句话说出了口，就是套上四匹马拉的车也难追上。

sentences.english: After the four children had shared their dreams, I looked at the Mom.
sentences.chinese: 在4个孩子说出他们的梦想后，我望向他们的母亲。

sentences.english: Fixing the boy with a steady look,the teacher forced him to tell the truth.
sentences.chinese: 老师的目光紧紧盯着学生，迫使他说出了真情。

sentences.english: His friends pressed him for the truth about his relationship with Yvonne.
sentences.chinese: 他的朋友逼他老实说出跟伊芳的关系。

sentences.english: Again, he would not name which cars have them.
sentences.chinese: 同样，他也不会说出含有这些元件的汽车的名字。

sentences.english: Not saying anything we want to say.
sentences.chinese: 而没有说出任何那些我们想说出的话。

definition: to blurt out/to let slip (an indiscreet remark)
(to express one's) true feelings/what is on one's mind/secret mind
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
to speak/to say/to talk/to gossip/to tell stories/talk/word
to think of/to call to mind/to anticipate
